gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੌ ਸਮੁੰਦ ਬਿਖੈ ਬੋਹਥੈ ਬਹਾੲਿ ਦੀਜੈ ਕੀਜੈ ਨ ਭਰੋਸੋ ਜੌ ਲੌ ਪਹੁਚੈ ਨ ਪਾਰ ਕੌ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Samound Bikhai Bohadai Bahaai Deejai , Keejai N Bharoso Jau Lau Pahouchai N Paar Kau ?
translation: Just as a ship is set to sail in the sea, but no one can know its fate till the time it reaches the shore beyond.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੌ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਾਨ ਖੇਤ ਹੇਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਜੋਤੈ ਬੋਵੈ ਮਾਨਤ ਕੁਸਲ ਅਾਨ ਪੈਠੇ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਦ੍ਵਾਰ ਕੌ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Krisaan Khayt Haytu Kari Jotai Bovai , Maanat Kousal Aan Paitthay Grih Dvaar Kau ?
translation: Just as a farmer happily and delightfully ploughs the field, sows the seed, but he celebrates his happiness only when the harvested grain is brought home.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਪਿਰ ਸੰਗਮ ਕੈ ਹੋਤ ਗਰ ਹਾਰ ਨਾਰਿ ਕਰਤ ਹੈ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਪੇਖਿ ਸੁਤ ਕੇ ਲਿਲਾਰ ਕੌ
transliteration: Jaisay Pir Sangam Kai Hot Gar Haar Naari , Karat Hai Preet Paykhi Sout Kay Lilaar Kau ?
translation: Just as a wife comes close to her husband to please him, but she considers her love a success only when she bears a son and he loves her.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਕਰੀਅੈ ਨ ਕਾਹੂ ਕੇਰੀ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ ਧੌ ਕੈਸੋ ਦਿਨ ਅਾਵੈ ਅੰਤ ਕਾਰ ਕੌ ॥੫੯੫॥
transliteration: Taisay Ousatati Nindaa Kareeai N Kaahoo Kayree , Jaaneeai Dhau Kaiso Din Aavai Ant Kaar Kau ?595?
translation: Similarly, no one should be praised or slandered before time. Who knows what sort of a day may dawn in the end that all his labour may bear fruit or not. (One may tread a wrong path and wander or will be accepted by the Guru ultimately).  (595)
